name: karma-test-explorer
description: Run your Karma or Angular project's Jasmine and Mocha tests from the Visual Studio Code sidebar
author: Lucas Ononiwu

scripts.rebuild: npm run clean && npm run build
scripts.validate: npm run format && npm run lint && npm run rebuild && npm run test && npm run bundle && npm run package

karmaTestExplorer.projectRootPath.description: The working directory where the project is located (relative to the root folder)

karmaTestExplorer.defaultAngularProjectN.description: The default Angular project to be loaded for testing. If not specified, the default project specified in `angular.json` is loaded instead

karmaTestExplorer.karmaConfFilePath.description: The path where the karma.conf.js file is located (relative to `projectRootPath`)

karmaTestExplorer.testGrouping.description: How tests should be grouped in the Test view sidebar
enumDescriptions: Group tests solely by test suite
Group tests by folder and test suite

karmaTestExplorer.karmaProcessExecutable.description: The path to the executable or command to use for launching Karma. This is useful for using a custom script or version of Karma

karmaTestExplorer.karmaPort.description: The port to be used for the Karma server in VS Code

karmaTestExplorer.testsBasePath.description: The base folder containing the test files (relative to `projectRootPath`)

karmaTestExplorer.testFiles.description: The path glob patterns identifying the test files (relative to `projectRootPath`)

karmaTestExplorer.excludeFiles.description: The path glob patterns identifying files to be excluded from `testFiles` (relative to `projectRootPath`)

karmaTestExplorer.reloadOnChangedFiles.description: A list of files which when modified will trigger a Karma reload

karmaTestExplorer.reloadOnKarmaConfigCha.description: Enables reloading of Karma on changes to the Karma configuration file

karmaTestExplorer.testFramework.description: The test framework used by the project
enumDescriptions: The Jasmine test framework. All capabilities are supported with this test framework, including auto-watch mode
The BDD (Behavior Driven Development) interface of the Mocha test framework. Some capabilities, such as auto-watch mode, are not supported with this framework
The TDD (Test Driven Development) interface of the Mocha test framework. Some capabilities, such as auto-watch mode, are not supported with this framework

karmaTestExplorer.logLevel.description: Sets the level of logging detail produced in the output panel of the extension. More detailed levels such as the `debug` level can be helpful when troubleshooting issues with running Karma or the extension. Set this to `disable` in order to disable extension logging and not display the Karma Test Explorer output panel at all
enumDescriptions: Log errors, warnings and info level messages
More detailed logging which includes debug level information
Very detailed logging which includes very low level information. This logging level is very verbose

karmaTestExplorer.karmaLogLevel.description: Sets the level of logging detail for the Karma server in its output channel, which can be helpful when troubleshooting issues with running Karma or the extension. Set this to `disable` in order to disable Karma logging and not display the Karma Server output panel at all
enumDescriptions: Log errors, warnings and info level messages
More detailed logging which includes debug level information
Very detailed logging which includes very low level information. This logging level is very verbose

karmaTestExplorer.autoWatchEnabled.description: Enables automatic re-run of tests with changes to test files

karmaTestExplorer.autoWatchBatchDelay.description: The delay in milliseconds when autoWatch is enabled for batching multiple file changes into a single rerun. This is the same as (and overrides) Karma config's `autoWatchBatchDelay` option

karmaTestExplorer.karmaReadyTimeout.description: The duration in milliseconds after which the extension will stop listening and give up if Karma is not started, connected to the extension, and ready for testing

karmaTestExplorer.flattenSingleChildFold.description: Flatten test paths consisting of single child folders

karmaTestExplorer.defaultSocketConnectio.description: This is the port that will be used to connect Karma with the test explorer. When not specified, Karma Test Explorer will automatically use the first available port equal to, or higher than, 9999

karmaTestExplorer.browser.description: The browser that will be launched by Karma for testing, which can be the name of any valid custom launcher defined or available in the Karma config file. This takes precedence over the `customLauncher` setting

karmaTestExplorer.customLauncher.description: Specify the karma custom launcher configuration for launching the test browser, similar to a custom launcher entry in a karma config file. The default uses the same debug port as the default `debuggerConfig` setting to attach the debugger to the browser. Therefore, if providing a custom value for `customLauncher`, ensure that both the `customLauncher` and `debuggerConfig` settings use matching debug ports

karmaTestExplorer.debuggerConfigName.description: The name of the launch configuration that will be used for debugging tests, which can be the name of any launch configuration defined or available in the VS Code `launch.json` file. This takes precedence over the `debuggerConfig` setting

karmaTestExplorer.debuggerConfig.description: The debugger configuration to be used in debugging the Karma tests in VS Code. This is similar to a VS Code launch configuration entry in the `.vscode/launch.json` file

karmaTestExplorer.containerModeEnabled.description: Enables additional support for easier testing in a container

karmaTestExplorer.env.description: Additional environment variables to be set when running the tests. These take precedence over those from the `envFile` setting

karmaTestExplorer.envFile.description: Path to environment file containing environment variables to be set when running the tests
